data.title: St. Mary the Virgin Fordwich
data.meta_description: First let me say do take note about how cold the church can be, even in summer. We did use the hot water bottles which were provided. It's a beautiful old churc
data.text:
First let me say do take note about how cold the church can be, even in summer. We did use the hot water bottles which were provided.

It’s a beautiful old church that feels far away from everything but there’s a pub near next door (I’m told it’s a bit expensive) and one just down the road. Mark’s and Spencer Food and McDonald’s is a four minute drive away. Sturry station is a 10 to 15 minute walk away. There are some beautiful walks along the Stour Valley. One other thing – the camp beds, which are surprisingly comfortable, can be tricky to get in to if you have mobility issues. I had to have mine moved into the aisle. It was a beautiful relaxing stay.
